section.title: Deploying and Undeploying Resource Adapters
section.para: Resource adapters can be deployed using the Management Console or, alternatively, by invoking ant tasks, or by copying deployable unit files from the resources/resource_adapter subdirectory of a platform or server installation into JBoss's deploy directory.

section.title: Deploying Resource Adapters Using the Management Console
section.para: Resource adapters can be deployed from the Install tab of the Deployable Units section of the Management Console.

Clicking on the Browse... button opens your browser's file selector. Navigate to the <install_directory>/resources/resource_adapter/ subdirectory, where resource_adapter corresponds to the resource adapter you want to install. For example, if you wanted to install the HTTP Servlet resource adapter:

caption.para: Selecting the HTTP Servlet deployable unit

section.para: Deployable units are JAR files which contain -ra-DU in their file names. Simply select that file in the file chooser and click Open. Finally, you must click the Install button to install the deployable unit file, and therefore the corresponding resource adapter.

formalpara.title: Ensuring the Resource Adapter Is Installed
formalpara.para: You can ensure that the resource adapter deployed successfully by clicking on the Resources section in the Mobicents Management Console. There, under Resource Adapters, you should now see all of the resource adapters listed which you have deployed so far. In the screenshot, you can see that both the HTTP Servlet and HTTP Client resource adapters have been deployed.

caption.para: HTTP Servlet and HTTP Client RAs successfully deployed

section.title: Deploying Resource Adapters Using Ant and JMX
section.para: Alternatively, you can install resource adapters by issuing an ant command in the directory corresponding to the resource adapter that you want to deploy. All resource adapters are located in subdirectories of the <install_directory>/resources/ directory.
